node.title: Stephen Colbert Comments on the ‘Slides of Sedition’
node.alt: “PowerPoint? They weren’t just trying to overturn democracy, they were trying to bore it to death,” Stephen Colbert said on Monday night.
node.description: Colbert couldn’t believe Congress is currently investigating a 38-page PowerPoint document detailing plans to overturn the 2020 election.
node.content: ["Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night\u2019s highlights that lets you sleep \u2014 and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.", "The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol is looking into a 38-page PowerPoint document sent to President Trump\u2019s chief of staff, Mark Meadows, that included plans to overturn the 2020 election.", "\u201cPowerPoint? They weren\u2019t just trying to overturn democracy, they were trying to bore it to death,\u201d Stephen Colbert said on Monday night.", "Tom Holland, Regina King and Ted Danson are just a few of the celebrities reading mean tweets about themselves in a new edition of the popular recurring segment of \u201cJimmy Kimmel Live.\u201d", "Chelsea Handler will stop by Tuesday\u2019s \u201cDaily Show.\u201d", "A new documentary about \u201cSesame Street\u201d details how social purpose has always been a part of the long-running children\u2019s show."]
